description:
In the near future, a sudden and unexplained sea rise has left much of human civilization underwater. Ikaruga Natsuki, a boy who lost his mother and one of his legs in an accident some years earlier, returns disillusioned from a harsh life in the big city to find his old countryside home half-swallowed by the sea. Left without a family, all he has to his name is the ship and submarine left to him by his oceanologist grandmother, and her debts. His only hope to restore the dreams for the future that he has lost is to take up an opportunity presented to him by the suspicious debt collector Catherine. They set sail to search the sunken ruins of his grandmother's laboratory in order to find a treasure rumor says she left there. But what they find is not riches or jewels; it is a strange girl lying asleep in a coffin at the bottom of the sea, Atri. Atri is a robot, but her appearance and her wealth of emotions would fool anyone into thinking she's a living, breathing human being. In gratitude for being salvaged, she makes a declaration to Natsuki.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: アトリ マイ ディア モーメンツ

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

Motoyon is a Japanese illustrator, known for their work on KeroMakura titles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/moto4_koinu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/448586)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

Matsumoto Fuminori, also known as Szak, is the representative of Metrowing which mainly produces musical composition. He produces several soundtracks for Visual Novel, his best known works are the songs of Grisaia no Rakuen, Subarashiki Hibi, ATRI -My Dear Moments-, Sakura no Uta and Sakura no Toki.

22/7 is a Japanese digital seiyuu idol group. The project is described as "Idols Who Cross Dimensions."

Nogizaka46 (乃木坂46, Nogizaka Forty-six) is a Japanese female idol group produced by Yasushi Akimoto, created as the official rival (公式ライバル, koushiki raibaru) of the group AKB48. They are the first group from the Sakamichi Series, which also includes sister groups Sakurazaka46 (formerly Keyakizaka46), Yoshimotozaka46, and Hinatazaka46.

Yasushi Akimoto is a Japanese record producer, lyricist and television writer, best known for creating and producing some of Japan's top idol groups Onyanko Club and the [AKB48](https://anilist.co/staff/107010) franchise.

He also contributed in forming South Korean girl group IZ*ONE with collaboration between AKS and Mnet.

In 2016, Japanese idol girl group multimedia project between Yasushi Akimoto, Aniplex, and Sony Music Records called [22/7](https://anilist.co/staff/151947) was formed. The project is described as "idols who transcend dimensions." The members consist of voice actresses who provide the voice and motion capture for their characters, as well as perform as a musical group.

[YUSVOX Inc](https://yusvox.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/yu_jin_ks)

They are a composer and arranger affiliated with Alpha Enterprises as well as CEO of their own company, YUSVOX Inc. They have composed and arranged for various idol groups such as [22/7](https://anilist.co/staff/151947/227), [Nogizaka46](https://anilist.co/staff/201277/Nogizaka46) and [SKE48](https://anilist.co/staff/110247/SKE48).

[Twitter](https://x.com/enakiri0507)

Freelance animator since 2024. Formerly affiliated with P.A Works between 2021-2024.

They also work as a vtuber on top of being an animator.

He produces several soundtracks for Visual Novel, his best known works are the songs of Grisaia no Rakuen, Subarashiki Hibi, ATRI -My Dear Moments-, Sakura no Uta and Sakura no Toki.
